: : LANDS BELONGING TO LAND REFORM COMMISSION :
. ( ( - ) (The Hon. Achala Jagodage on behalf of the Hon. Buddhika Pathirana) - (3) :
asked the Minister of Mahaweli Development and Environment:

(a) Will he inform this House - (i) the extent of land belongs to the Land Reform Commission that is administered by the District Forest Officers Office in Kandy; (ii) whether he is aware that Pines and other trees have been cultivated by the Department of Forest Conservation in those lands; and (iii) the extent of land in which such trees have been cultivated?

(b) Is he aware that - (i) certain individuals have illegally encroached those lands in which trees have been cultivated by the Department of Forest Conservation; and (ii) a portion of those lands have been given to the people by the Government?

(c) Will he also inform this House - (i) separately, the extent of land in which people have illegally settled and given to the people by the Government, out of the forest lands mentioned in (a)(iii) above; (ii) whether he admits the fact that catchment areas get destroyed owing to the use of forest reserves by the people; and (iii) if so, whether steps will be taken to avoid this from happening?
( ( - ) (The Hon. Gayantha Karunatileka - Minister of Mass Media and Chief Government Whip) , * .
SHORTAGE OF DRUGS IN HOSPITALS : REMEDY
. ( ( - ) (The Hon. Achala Jagodage on behalf of the Hon. Ashok Abeysinghe) - (3):
() , ? asked the Minister of Health and Indigenous Medicine:

(a) Will he inform this House - (i) whether local purchase of pharmaceuticals has been permitted as a remedy for the shortage of drugs in hospitals; (ii) the procedure for calling of bids for the aforesaid purchases; (iii) whether there is a procedure for comparing the aforesaid prices with those of the Medical Supplies Division; and (iv) whether the Ministry is aware of the malpractices that have taken place with regard to purchase of pharmaceuticals by the Peradeniya General Hospital;
( ( ( ( ) - ) (The Hon. (Dr.) Rajitha Senaratne - Minister of Health and Indigenous Medicine) , * .
( - ) (The Hon. Achala Jagodage on behalf of the Hon. Ajith Mannapperuma ) 2 - (1):

(i) whether action will be taken to pay the farmers pension (which has been implemented with effect from 11th October, 1995) to the spouse or the dependents of persons who had been receiving the pension at the time of their death with effect from 01st January, 2014; and
(ii) if not, the reasons for not doing so?

(i) the persons who became eligible for the pension by paying a lump sum of Rs. 3400/- at the age of 27 years in 1987; the persons who became eligible for the pension by paying a lump sum of Rs. 5740/- at the age of 45 years in 2010; and the persons who have continued to pay a sum of Rs. 175/- as the bi-annual premium starting at the age of twenty seven years in 1987 are expected to pay an additional sum of money to be able to receive the pension as per the new scheme that was launched with effect from 01st January, 2014; and
(ii) if so, separately the amount of money to be paid by the relevant individuals in terms of each of the aforesaid scenarios?
(c) If not, why? ( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) , * .
ALLOWANCE TO JULY STRIKERS : BUDGET PROPOSAL
( - ) (The Hon. Achala Jagodage on behalf of the Hon. Buddhika Pathirana) 2 - (2) :

(a) Will he state - (i) the number of persons who have been paid the allowance of Rs. 5000/- as per the proposal of the 2013 Budget to grant such an allowance for those who lost their jobs at the 1980 July strike and have hitherto not received any relief; and (ii) the amount of money spent by the Government, as of now, to grant this allowance?
(b) Will he inform this House of -

(i) the procedure adopted regarding the payment of the said benefit to the relevant beneficiaries of those July strikers who had already died without receiving any benefit at the time the proposal in (a)(i) above came into effect; and
(ii) the procedure to be adopted by a person who has thus far not received any relief after losing the job at the 1980 July strike, to receive the above allowance?
(c) If not, why? ( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) , *.
: HOSPITALS UNDER MINISTRY OF HEALTH AND
4778/14 0. ( ( - ) (The Hon. Achala Jagodage on behalf of the Hon. Ashok Abeysinghe) - (2):
() , ? asked the Minister of Health and Indigenous Medicine:
(i) the total number of hospitals that come under the Ministry of Health and Indigenous Medicine;
(ii) the number of hospitals that come under the Provincial Councils;
(iii) whether the programmes in the Budget 2012 to uplift the standards of the hospitals that come under the Provincial Councils have been implemented; and
(iv) whether he is aware that under the aforesaid programmes the Provincial Councils have distributed unwanted equipment to the hospitals that come under them?
(b) Will he also inform this House separately, with respect to each province the amount of money allocated to provincial hospitals under the above programme in (a)(iii)?
(c) If not, why? ( ( ( ) ) (The Hon. (Dr.) Rajitha Senaratne) , * .
( - ) (The Hon. Achala Jagodage on behalf of the Hon. Buddhika Pathirana) - (2) :
() , ? asked the Minister of Foreign Employment:

(a) Will she inform this House - (i) whether she is aware that a proposal was made through the Budget Proposals of the year 2013 to establish two new Foreign Employment Technical Colleges where special courses will be conducted to upgrade the skills of the Sri Lankans who migrate for employment and to make it easier for them to get adapted to the social and cultural environments of their destination countries; (ii) the locations in which the aforesaid two colleges have been established; (iii) the total amount of money that has been invested on it; (iv) the areas of employment for which training is provided in the aforesaid colleges; and (v) the number of "Rataviruwos" who have been trained in the aforesaid colleges and migrated for employment?
: PRICE CONTROL OF MEDICINAL DRUGS : DETAILS
4. ( ( - ) (The Hon. Achala Jagodage on behalf of the Hon. Ashok Abeysinghe) - (2):
() , ? asked the Minister of Health and Indigenous Medicine:

(a) Will he inform this House - (i) whether a price control is in effect in the island at present in respect of medicinal drugs; (ii) whether he is aware that a price control process had been in operation in Sri Lanka some time ago; (iii) if so, whether he will state the specific period during which this price control had been in operation; (iv) as to how many varieties of drugs had been subjected to price control during that period; and (v) whether the Committee appointed for controlling prices of medicinal drugs has given its recommendations pertaining to it?
BUSINESS OF THE PARLIAMENT 2 ( ) (The Hon. Lakshman Kiriella) I move,
That the proceedings on Item Nos. 10 to 15 of Public Business appearing on the Order Paper be exempted at this days sitting from the provisions of the Standing Order No. 23.
That notwithstanding the provisions of Standing Order 7(1), the Parliament shall sit on Monday, April 27th, 2015.
: : The following Motion stood on the Order Paper:

"That notwithstanding the provisions of Standing Order No. 7 and the motion agreed to by Parliament on 09.07.2010, the hours of sitting on Wednesday, April 22nd, 2015 shall be 9.30 a.m. to 6.30 p.m. At 6.30 p.m. Mr. Speaker shall adjourn the Parliament without question put." 2 ( ) (The Hon. Lakshman Kiriella) Sir, there is an Amendment to the above Item, the date to read as "Monday, April 27th, 2015" and the time to read as "8.30 p.m". Accordingly, I move,

That notwithstanding the provisions of Standing Order No. 7 and the motion agreed to by Parliament on 09.07.2010, the hours of sitting on Monday, April 27th, 2015 shall be 9.30 a.m. to 8.30 p.m. At 8.30 p.m. Mr. Speaker shall adjourn the Parliament without question put.
III : : The following Motion stood next on the Order Paper:
That this Parliament at its rising this day do adjourn until 9.30 a.m. on Wednesday, April 22nd, 2015."
2 ( ) (The Hon. Lakshman Kiriella) Sir, there is an Amendment to the above Item, the date to read as, "Monday, April 27th, 2015". Accordingly, I move,
That this Parliament at its rising this day do adjourn until 9.30 a.m. on Monday, April 27th, 2015." , . . Question put, and agreed to.
Adjourned accordingly at 12.45 p.m. until 9.30 a.m. on Monday, 27th April, 2015, pursuant to the Resolution of Parliament of this Day.
Corrections which Members suggest for the Final Print should be clearly marked in their copy and sent to be Editor of HANSARD within two weeks of
